flavor_text_entries.black:
Its ear is hexagonal in shape.
Compressed underground,
its body is as hard as steel.
flavor_text_entries.white:
They were discovered a hundred years
ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside
each one is an energy core.
flavor_text_entries.black-2:
The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear.
It has a tendency to walk in the
direction the sound is coming from.
flavor_text_entries.white-2:
The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear.
It has a tendency to walk in the
direction the sound is coming from.
flavor_text_entries.x:
Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed
underground, its body is as hard as steel.
flavor_text_entries.y:
They were discovered a hundred years ago in an
earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an
energy core.
flavor_text_entries.omega-ruby:
Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed
underground, its body is as hard as steel.
flavor_text_entries.alpha-sapphire:
They were discovered a hundred years ago in an
earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an
energy core.
flavor_text_entries.sun:
Born deep within the ground, it compares itself
with similar species, such as Geodude and
Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
flavor_text_entries.moon:
The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the
direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds
cease, it panics and topples over.
flavor_text_entries.ultra-sun:
The hexagonal hole is its ear. Deep in that ear is
an energy core, so if you stick your hand in
there, Roggenrola will be very angry!
flavor_text_entries.ultra-moon:
It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed
rock. The material that makes up its body is
dirt from several hundred years ago.
flavor_text_entries.sword:
It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in
water will cause it to soften a bit.
flavor_text_entries.shield:
When it detects a noise, it starts to move.
The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon
slightly warm to the touch.
